abstract: Bebo has developed a system to let applications written for Facebook run on its social network. Facebook then decided to let other networks do the same. All this is meant to fight off the Google-MySpace environment called OpenSocial.
snippet: Bebo has developed a system to let applications written for Facebook run on its social network. Facebook then decided to let other networks do the same. All this is meant to fight off the Google-MySpace environment called OpenSocial.
lead_paragraph: When last we looked at the world of “platforms” that let developers write applications for social networks, Google had announced its OpenSocial standard, backed by MySpace, LinkedIn and others. This was meant to counter the activity on Facebook, which had generated a lot of applications with its own platform introduced in August.

headline.main: Bebo Copies Facebook, Which Invites Others to Do the Same
